page.title: 09The Local Policeman.
page.content: We interviewed P.C.Woodcock. He came to work in this parish in 1983 after 9 years in the R.A.F. He trained in Kent for 10 weeks where he studied Law and physical fitness. On joining the police he got a motor cycle, uniform, handcuffs & truncheon. He lives with his wife and family in a police house.His wife acts as his secretary. His beat consists of 7 parishes which he patrols 8 hours a day and he is on 24 hr. call. Typical crimes in the area are burglaries, theft and vandalism. He detects an overall increase in the crime rate. In his spare time he fishes and does a lot of work in local schools. He is very happy working in this area and does not want promotion and he has never seriously thought about retirement.
